result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D Steinle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • County Retail Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D Steinle

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Steven D Steinle
Current: 1722 Onsgard Rd Apt 1, Madison, WI 53704   (Effective: 07-15-2022)
Prior: 1722 Onsgard Rd 1, Madison, WI 53704

Defendant Steven D Steinle in court.  Attorney Will Davis for Frank John Remington in court for State of Wisconsin. State amends ct 1 to ordinance retail theft. Jt; plea ct 1 for court costs. 

Def entered a plea of no contest to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: ct 1: ordinance retail theft: 32.03/943.50(1m)(b)

Court orders court costs.

Becky K

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Kohls department store in Dane County. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

08:39 AM Defendant appeared.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
